content: of a worsted-weight yarn s slip sm slip marker samples shown ssk slip slip knit slip 2 stitches one at a time on front elmer fingering in color pop rocks held together with as if to knit knit them together through the birdie in color cake pop shown in size 2 with 7 of ease back loop 1 st decrease d above spincycle yarns dyed in the wool in color pinky st s stitch es swear held together with birdie in color thunder shown in size 3 with 6 5 of ease ws wrong side laura pullover version 1 // ©2024 the lamb & kid // all rights reserved for personal use only no portion of this pattern may be reproduced or distributed in any form or by any means without written permission p 2 pattern notes sweater is worked seamlessly from the top down gsrs are worked to shape the neck and raise the back where the pattern says gsr you ll work a double stitch slip the stitch on the left hand needle to the right hand needle and yarnover firmly positioning your yarn to knit or purl depending on your row on the next row you ll resolve this double stitch when you come to it by knitting or purling both legs together adding additional length to the body or sleeves will require additional yarn not calculated in yarn estimates directions for sweater mock neck with ribbing needle co 80 84 84 88 88 92 96 96 96 sts using the co method of your choice place bor m and join to work in the round ribbing round *k3 p1 repeat from * to end work in rib pattern as est until piece measures 4 / 10cm from co work the following set-up round bor m will be at the center back gsr 4 gsr purl to bor m slipping the raglan markers as k15 16 17 19 20 21 22 22 23 sts back pm k10 10 you come to them sm purl to 1 st before raglan marker 8 6 4 4 4 4 2 sts sleeve pm k30 32 34 38 40 42 m1rp p1 sm p1 m1lp purl across sleeve sts until 1 st before 44 44 46 sts front pm k10 10 8 6 4 4 4 4 2 sts next raglan marker m1rp p1 sm p1 m1lp purl to previous sleeve pm k15 16 17 19 20 21 22 22 23 sts back gsr purling the double st p2 turn work 4 sts increase d repeat gsrs 3 & 4 two more times short row gsr 9 gsr knit to bor m slipping raglan markers as you come to them change to gauge needle next round knit resolving any double sts as you come to them now work gsrs while also increasing at the raglan markers as follows 32 sts increase d 112 116 116 120 120 124 128 128 128 sts gsr 1 knit to 1 st before first raglan
